intro: Fedia scorpioides, commonly known as the scorpionweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by bracts that resemble scorpion tails, giving it its common name. Fedia scorpioides typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
